1357 continue;
1358 }
1359 const int max_lift = p.best_nearby_lifting_assist( src_loc );
1360 const int lvl = std::ceil( units::quantity<double, units::mass::unit_type>( base.weight() ) /
1361 TOOL_LIFT_FACTOR );
1362 const bool use_aid = max_lift >= lvl;
1363 const bool use_str = p.can_lift( base.lift_strength() );
1364 if( !( use_aid || use_str ) ) {
1365 continue;
1366 }
1367 const auto &reqs = vpinfo.removal_requirements();
1368 const inventory &inv = p.crafting_inventory( false );
1369
1370 const bool can_make = reqs.can_make_with_inventory( inv, is_crafting_component );
1371 p.set_value( "veh_index_type", vpinfo.name() );
1372 // temporarily store the intended index, we do this so two NPCs don't try and work on the same part at same time.
1373 p.activity_vehicle_part_index = vpindex;
1374 if( !can_make ) {
1375 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_VEH_DECONST );
1376 } else {
1377 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_VEH_DECONST );
1378 }
1379 }
1380 } else if( act == ACT_VEHICLE_REPAIR ) {
1381 // find out if there is a vehicle part here we can repair.
1382 std::vector<vehicle_part *> parts = veh->get_parts_at( src_loc, "", part_status_flag::any );
1383 for( vehicle_part *part_elem : parts ) {
1384 const vpart_info &vpinfo = part_elem->info();
1385 int vpindex = veh->index_of_part( part_elem, true );
1386 // if part is undamaged or beyond repair - can skip it.
1387 if( part_elem->is_broken() || part_elem->damage() == 0 ||
1388 part_elem->info().repair_requirements().is_empty() ) {
1389 continue;
1390 }
1391 if( std::find( already_working_indexes.begin(), already_working_indexes.end(),
1392 vpindex ) != already_working_indexes.end() ) {
1393 continue;
1394 }
1395 // don't have skill to repair it
1396 if( !has_skill_for_vehicle_work( vpinfo.repair_skills, p ) ) {
1397 continue;
1398 }
1399 const auto &reqs = vpinfo.repair_requirements();
1400 const inventory &inv = p.crafting_inventory( src_loc, PICKUP_RANGE - 1, false );
1401 const bool can_make = reqs.can_make_with_inventory( inv, is_crafting_component );
1402 p.set_value( "veh_index_type", vpinfo.name() );
1403 // temporarily store the intended index, we do this so two NPCs don't try and work on the same part at same time.
1404 p.activity_vehicle_part_index = vpindex;
1405 if( !can_make ) {
1406 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_VEH_REPAIR );
1407 } else {
1408 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_VEH_REPAIR );
1409 }
1410 }
1411 }
1412 p.activity_vehicle_part_index = -1;
1413 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1414 }
1415 if( act == ACT_MULTIPLE_MINE ) {
1416 if( !here.has_flag( "MINEABLE", src_loc ) ) {
1417 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1418 }
1419 std::vector<item *> mining_inv = p.items_with( []( const item & itm ) {
1420 return ( itm.has_flag( flag_DIG_TOOL ) && !itm.type->can_use( "JACKHAMMER" ) ) ||
1421 ( itm.type->can_use( "JACKHAMMER" ) && itm.ammo_sufficient() );
1422 } );
1423 if( mining_inv.empty() ) {
1424 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_MINING );
1425 } else {
1426 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_MINING );
1427 }
1428 }
1429 if( act == ACT_MULTIPLE_FISH ) {
1430 if( !here.has_flag( flag_FISHABLE, src_loc ) ) {
1431 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1432 }
1433 std::vector<item *> rod_inv = p.items_with( []( const item & itm ) {
1434 return itm.has_flag( flag_FISH_POOR ) || itm.has_flag( flag_FISH_GOOD );
1435 } );
1436 if( rod_inv.empty() ) {
1437 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_FISHING );
1438 } else {
1439 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_FISHING );
1440 }
1441 }
1442 if( act == ACT_MULTIPLE_CHOP_TREES ) {
1443 if( here.has_flag( flag_TREE, src_loc ) || here.ter( src_loc ) == t_trunk ||
1444 here.ter( src_loc ) == t_stump ) {
1445 if( p.has_quality( qual_AXE ) ) {
1446 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_TREE_CHOPPING );
1447 } else {
1448 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_TREE_CHOPPING );
1449 }
1450 } else {
1451 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1452 }
1453 }
1454 if( act == ACT_MULTIPLE_BUTCHER ) {
1455 std::vector<item> corpses;
1456 int big_count = 0;
1457 int small_count = 0;
1458 for( const auto &i : here.i_at( src_loc ) ) {
1459 // make sure nobody else is working on that corpse right now
1460 if( i.is_corpse() && !i.has_var( "activity_var" ) ) {
1461 const mtype corpse = *i.get_mtype();
1462 if( corpse.size >= MS_MEDIUM ) {
1463 big_count += 1;
1464 } else {
1465 small_count += 1;
1466 }
1467 corpses.push_back( i );
1468 }
1469 }
1470 bool b_rack_present = false;
1471 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( src_loc, 2 ) ) {
1472 const inventory &inv = p.crafting_inventory();
1473 if( here.has_flag_furn( flag_BUTCHER_EQ, pt ) || inv.has_item_with( []( const item & it ) {
1474 return it.has_flag( "BUTCHER_RACK" );
1475 } ) ) {
1476 b_rack_present = true;
1477 }
1478 }
1479 if( !corpses.empty() ) {
1480 if( big_count > 0 && small_count == 0 ) {
1481 const inventory &inv = p.crafting_inventory();
1482 if( !b_rack_present || !( here.has_nearby_table( src_loc, PICKUP_RANGE ) ||
1483 inv.has_item_with( []( const item & it ) {
1484 return it.has_flag( "FLAT_SURFACE" );
1485 } ) ) ) {
1486 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1487 }
1488 if( p.has_quality( quality_id( qual_BUTCHER ), 1 ) ) {
1489 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_BIG_BUTCHERING );
1490 } else {
1491 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_BIG_BUTCHERING );
1492 }
1493 }
1494 if( ( big_count > 0 && small_count > 0 ) || ( big_count == 0 ) ) {
1495 // there are small corpses here, so we can ignore any big corpses here for the moment.
1496 if( p.has_quality( qual_BUTCHER, 1 ) ) {
1497 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_BUTCHERING );
1498 } else {
1499 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_BUTCHERING );
1500 }
1501 }
1502 }
1503 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1504 }
1505 if( act == ACT_MULTIPLE_CHOP_PLANKS ) {
1506 //are there even any logs there?
1507 for( auto &i : here.i_at( src_loc ) ) {
1508 if( i.typeId() == itype_log ) {
1509 // do we have an axe?
1510 if( p.has_quality( qual_AXE, 1 ) ) {
1511 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_CHOPPING );
1512 } else {
1513 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_CHOPPING );
1514 }
1515 }
1516 }
1517 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1518 }
1519 if( act == ACT_TIDY_UP ) {
1520 if( mgr.has_near( zone_type_LOOT_UNSORTED, here.getabs( src_loc ), distance ) ||
1521 mgr.has_near( z_camp_storage, here.getabs( src_loc ), distance ) ) {
1522 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::CAN_DO_FETCH );
1523 }
1524 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1525 }
1526 if( act == ACT_MULTIPLE_CONSTRUCTION ) {
1527 zones = mgr.get_zones( zone_type_CONSTRUCTION_BLUEPRINT,
1528 here.getabs( src_loc ) );
1529 const partial_con *part_con = here.partial_con_at( src_loc );
1530 cata::optional<construction_id> part_con_idx;
1531 if( part_con ) {
1532 part_con_idx = part_con->id;
1533 }
1534 const map_stack stuff_there = here.i_at( src_loc );
1535
1536 // PICKUP_RANGE -1 because we will be adjacent to the spot when arriving.
1537 const inventory pre_inv = p.crafting_inventory( src_loc, PICKUP_RANGE - 1 );
1538 for( const zone_data &zone : zones ) {
1539 const blueprint_options &options = dynamic_cast<const blueprint_options &>( zone.get_options() );
1540 const construction_id index = options.get_index();
1541 if( !stuff_there.empty() ) {
1542 return activity_reason_info::build( do_activity_reason::BLOCKING_TILE, false, index );
1543 }
1544 std::set<construction_id> used_idx;
1545 const activity_reason_info act_info = find_base_construction(
1546 constructions::get_all_sorted(), p, pre_inv, src_loc, part_con_idx, index, used_idx
1547 );
1548 return act_info;
1549 }
1550 } else if( act == ACT_MULTIPLE_FARM ) {
1551 zones = mgr.get_zones( zone_type_FARM_PLOT,
1552 here.getabs( src_loc ) );
1553 for( const zone_data &zone : zones ) {
1554 if( here.has_flag_furn( flag_GROWTH_HARVEST, src_loc ) ) {
1555 // simple work, pulling up plants, nothing else required.
1556 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_HARVESTING );
1557 } else if( here.has_flag( flag_PLOWABLE, src_loc ) && !here.has_furn( src_loc ) ) {
1558 if( p.has_quality( qual_DIG, 1 ) ) {
1559 // we have a shovel/hoe already, great
1560 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_TILLING );
1561 } else {
1562 // we need a shovel/hoe
1563 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_TILLING );
1564 }
1565 } else if( here.has_flag_ter_or_furn( flag_PLANTABLE, src_loc ) &&
1566 warm_enough_to_plant( src_loc ) ) {
1567 if( here.has_items( src_loc ) ) {
1568 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::BLOCKING_TILE );
1569 } else {
1570 // do we have the required seed on our person?
1571 const plot_options &options = dynamic_cast<const plot_options &>( zone.get_options() );
1572 const itype_id seed = options.get_seed();
1573 // If its a farm zone with no specified seed, and we've checked for tilling and harvesting.
1574 // then it means no further work can be done here
1575 if( seed.is_empty() ) {
1576 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::ALREADY_DONE );
1577 }
1578 std::vector<item *> seed_inv = p.items_with( []( const item & itm ) {
1579 return itm.is_seed();
1580 } );
1581 for( const auto elem : seed_inv ) {
1582 if( elem->typeId() == itype_id( seed ) ) {
1583 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_PLANTING );
1584 }
1585 }
1586 // didn't find the seed, but maybe there are overlapping farm zones
1587 // and another of the zones is for a seed that we have
1588 // so loop again, and return false once all zones done.
1589 }
1590
1591 } else {
1592 // can't plant, till or harvest
1593 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::ALREADY_DONE );
1594 }
1595
1596 }
1597 // looped through all zones, and only got here if its plantable, but have no seeds.
1598 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NEEDS_PLANTING );
1599 } else if( act == ACT_FETCH_REQUIRED ) {
1600 // we check if its possible to get all the requirements for fetching at two other places.
1601 // 1. before we even assign the fetch activity and;
1602 // 2. when we form the src_set to loop through at the beginning of the fetch activity.
1603 return activity_reason_info::ok( do_activity_reason::CAN_DO_FETCH );
1604 }
1605 // Shouldn't get here because the zones were checked previously. if it does, set enum reason as "no zone"
1606 return activity_reason_info::fail( do_activity_reason::NO_ZONE );
1607}

Definition at line 411 of file activity_item_handling.cpp.

414{
415 std::list<pickup::act_item> res;
416
417 for( const drop_location &rec : drop ) {
418 const item_location loc = rec.loc;
419 const int count = rec.count;
420
421 if( !filter( loc ) ) {
422 continue;
423 } else if( !p.is_worn( *loc ) && !p.is_wielding( *loc ) ) {
424 // Special case. After dropping the first few items, the remaining items are already separated.
425 // That means: `drop` already contains references to each of the items in
426 // `p.inv.const_stack`, and `count` will be 1 for each of them.
427 // If we continued without this check, we iterate over `p.inv.const_stack` multiple times,
428 // but each time stopping after visiting the first item.
429 // In the end, we would add references to the same item (the first one in the stack) multiple times.
430 if( count == 1 ) {
431 res.emplace_back( loc, 1, loc.obtain_cost( p, 1 ) );
432 continue;
433 }
434 int obtained = 0;
435 for( const item &it : p.inv.const_stack( p.get_item_position( &*loc ) ) ) {
436 if( obtained >= count ) {
437 break;
438 }
439 const int qty = it.count_by_charges() ? std::min<int>( it.charges, count - obtained ) : 1;
440 obtained += qty;
441 item_location loc( p, const_cast<item *>( &it ) );
442 res.emplace_back( loc, qty, loc.obtain_cost( p, qty ) );
443 }
444 } else {
445 res.emplace_back( loc, count, p.is_wielding( *loc ) ? 0 : loc.obtain_cost( p ) );
446 }
447 }
448
449 return res;
450}

1751 // we don't need to fetch those, they will be used automatically in the construction.
1752 // a shovel for tilling, for example, however, needs to be picked up, no matter if its near the spot or not.
1753 if( !pickup_task ) {
1754 if( std::find( already_there_spots.begin(), already_there_spots.end(),
1755 point_elem ) != already_there_spots.end() ) {
1756 continue;
1757 }
1758 }
1759 requirement_map.push_back( std::make_tuple( point_elem, map_elem.first, map_elem.second ) );
1760 }
1761 }
1762 // Ok we now have a list of all the items that match the requirements, their points, and a quantity for each one.
1763 // we need to consolidate them, and winnow it down to the minimum required counts, instead of all matching.
1764 for( const std::vector<item_comp> &elem : req_comps ) {
1765 bool line_found = false;
1766 for( const item_comp &comp_elem : elem ) {
1767 if( line_found || comp_elem.count <= 0 ) {
1768 break;
1769 }
1770 int quantity_required = comp_elem.count;
1771 int item_quantity = 0;
1772 auto it = requirement_map.begin();
1773 int remainder = 0;
1774 while( it != requirement_map.end() ) {
1775 tripoint pos_here = std::get<0>( *it );
1776 itype_id item_here = std::get<1>( *it );
1777 int quantity_here = std::get<2>( *it );
1778 if( comp_elem.type == item_here ) {
1779 item_quantity += quantity_here;
1780 }
1781 if( item_quantity >= quantity_required ) {
1782 // it's just this spot that can fulfil the requirement on its own
1783 final_map.push_back( std::make_tuple( pos_here, item_here, std::min<int>( quantity_here,
1784 quantity_required ) ) );
1785 if( quantity_here >= quantity_required ) {
1786 line_found = true;
1787 break;
1788 } else {
1789 remainder = quantity_required - quantity_here;
1790 }
1791 break;
1792 }
1793 it++;
1794 }
1795 if( line_found ) {
1796 while( true ) {
1797 // go back over things
1798 if( it == requirement_map.begin() ) {
1799 break;
1800 }
1801 if( remainder <= 0 ) {
1802 line_found = true;
1803 break;
1804 }
1805 tripoint pos_here2 = std::get<0>( *it );
1806 itype_id item_here2 = std::get<1>( *it );
1807 int quantity_here2 = std::get<2>( *it );
1808 if( comp_elem.type == item_here2 ) {
1809 if( quantity_here2 >= remainder ) {
1810 final_map.push_back( std::make_tuple( pos_here2, item_here2, remainder ) );
1811 line_found = true;
1812 } else {
1813 final_map.push_back( std::make_tuple( pos_here2, item_here2, remainder ) );
1814 remainder -= quantity_here2;
1815 }
1816 }
1817 it--;
1818 }
1819 }
1820 }
1821 }
1822 for( const std::vector<tool_comp> &elem : tool_comps ) {
1823 bool line_found = false;
1824 for( const tool_comp &comp_elem : elem ) {
1825 if( line_found || comp_elem.count < -1 ) {
1826 break;
1827 }
1828 int quantity_required = std::max( 1, comp_elem.count );
1829 int item_quantity = 0;
1830 auto it = requirement_map.begin();
1831 int remainder = 0;
1832 while( it != requirement_map.end() ) {
1833 tripoint pos_here = std::get<0>( *it );
1834 itype_id item_here = std::get<1>( *it );
1835 int quantity_here = std::get<2>( *it );
1836 if( comp_elem.type == item_here ) {
1837 item_quantity += quantity_here;
1838 }
1839 if( item_quantity >= quantity_required ) {
1840 // it's just this spot that can fulfil the requirement on its own
1841 final_map.push_back( std::make_tuple( pos_here, item_here, std::min<int>( quantity_here,
1842 quantity_required ) ) );
1843 if( quantity_here >= quantity_required ) {
1844 line_found = true;
1845 break;
1846 } else {
1847 remainder = quantity_required - quantity_here;
1848 }
1849 break;
1850 }
1851 it++;
1852 }
1853 if( line_found ) {
1854 while( true ) {
1855 // go back over things
1856 if( it == requirement_map.begin() ) {
1857 break;
1858 }
1859 if( remainder <= 0 ) {
1860 line_found = true;
1861 break;
1862 }
1863 tripoint pos_here2 = std::get<0>( *it );
1864 itype_id item_here2 = std::get<1>( *it );
1865 int quantity_here2 = std::get<2>( *it );
1866 if( comp_elem.type == item_here2 ) {
1867 if( quantity_here2 >= remainder ) {
1868 final_map.push_back( std::make_tuple( pos_here2, item_here2, remainder ) );
1869 line_found = true;
1870 } else {
1871 final_map.push_back( std::make_tuple( pos_here2, item_here2, remainder ) );
1872 remainder -= quantity_here2;
1873 }
1874 }
1875 it--;
1876 }
1877 }
1878 }
1879 }
1880 for( const std::vector<quality_requirement> &elem : quality_comps ) {
1881 bool line_found = false;
1882 for( const quality_requirement &comp_elem : elem ) {
1883 if( line_found || comp_elem.count <= 0 ) {
1884 break;
1885 }
1886 const quality_id tool_qual = comp_elem.type;
1887 const int qual_level = comp_elem.level;
1888 for( auto it = requirement_map.begin(); it != requirement_map.end(); ) {
1889 tripoint pos_here = std::get<0>( *it );
1890 itype_id item_here = std::get<1>( *it );
1891 item test_item = item( item_here, calendar::start_of_cataclysm );
1892 if( test_item.has_quality( tool_qual, qual_level ) ) {
1893 // it's just this spot that can fulfil the requirement on its own
1894 final_map.push_back( std::make_tuple( pos_here, item_here, 1 ) );
1895 line_found = true;
1896 break;
1897 }
1898 it++;
1899 }
1900 }
1901 }
1902 for( const std::tuple<tripoint, itype_id, int> &elem : final_map ) {
1903 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is fetching %s from x: %d y: %d ", p.disp_name(),
1904 std::get<1>( elem ).str(), std::get<0>( elem ).x, std::get<0>( elem ).y );
1905 }
1906 return final_map;
1907}
